title: Grilled Tuna With Corn-tomato Relish & Rosemary Potatoes
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Grilled Tuna With Corn-tomato Relish & Rosemary Potatoes a try. This recipe serves 4. Watching your figure? This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe has 584 calories, 49g of protein, and 23g of fat per serving. For $8.19 per serving, this recipe covers 53% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. Head to the store and pick up leaves stripped from 1 rosemary sprig, pepper, basil leaves, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the extra-virgin olive oil you could follow this main course with the Chocolate Date Caramel Walnut Tart (Gluten-Free, Grain-Free, Vegan) as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 1 hour and 47 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is amazing. Try Grilled Tuna With Sun-dried Tomato Relish, Grilled Salmon With Corn,tomato & Avocado Relish, and Grilled Salmon With Corn, Tomato, and Avocado Relish for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Raymond R Collection Merlot with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Raymond R Collection Merlot
productMatches.description: The Merlot fills the mouth with smooth cherry, raspberry and plum flavors along with hints of earth and spice in the toasty vanilla finish. Full-bodied, yet approachable, with a good balance of acid and tannins. Pair with anything from grilled salmon, pork tenderloin, barbequed chicken and ribs to Thai red curry or Moroccan tagine.
